Title:
The edible wide mushrooms of Agaricus section Bivelares from
Western China
Abstract:
Agaricus is a genus of macrofungi containing species with
highly edible and medicinal values. A mushroom survey carried out in
Qilian Mountain National Natural Reserve, in Gansu Province of China
recently, and yielded 21 Agaricus specimens. The morphological
examination and phylogenetic analysis based on four-gene sequences from
those specimens are conducted. The results show they are belonging to A.
section Bivelares and identified as: A. sinotetresporus sp. nov. and A.
qilianensis sp. nov. are new species for the world; A. devoniensis is a
new record from China; and the famous cultivated species A. bisporus is
found in the wild. All of them are described and illustrated in details.
The brief comparison with similar taxa or previous records are addressed
too.
